snippet: Policy makers and most investors have an interest in allowing troubled countries to restructure their debt.
abstract: Editorial warns that long-running legal dispute between Argentina and investors who own some of its bonds could force country to default on foreign debt by end of July; urges Argentina and creditors to reach compromise during scheduled negotiations in order to avert disaster for already weak Argentine economy; calls for policy makers around world to create more systematic way to deal with defaults by troubled governments.
lead_paragraph: Policy makers and most investors have an interest in allowing troubled countries to restructure their debt.
